text: The <extra_id_0> IL-2Ralpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter containing the nuclear factor kappa B ( NF-kappaB ) site was transcriptionally induced by M . tuberculosis and this NF-kappaB site could confer inducibility to a heterologous herpes thymidine kinase ( TK ) promoter by M . tuberculosis .
Electrophoretic mobility shift assays ( EMSAs ) revealed specific binding of nuclear protein to the NF-kappaB site upon induction with M . tuberculosis .

Using antibodies against the <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunits of NF-kappaB in EMSAs , the involvement of both <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins was further demonstrated .

Functional expression of the <extra_id_0> IL-2Ralpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on mononuclear phagocytes in M . tuberculosis infection may play an important immunomodulatory role in the host response .
